thread.title: Marks & Spencer’s digital hub at centre of change
thread.title_full: Marks & Spencer’s digital hub at centre of change

title: Marks & Spencer’s digital hub at centre of change
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Marks & Spencer’s digital hub at centre of change Marks & Spencer’s digital team has grown from 12 to over 200 in just under three years 1 of 1 Marks & Spencer’s digital team has grown from 12 to over 200 in just under three years Richard Fletcher Published at 12:01AM, October 15 2015 
A short walk from Marks & Spencer’s Richard Rogers-designed Paddington HQ is an anonymous refurbished 1950s building. 
It is a world apart from M&S’s glass-fronted head office, and not just because of the cheap carpet. Twentysomethings are crammed into every corner, working on Apple Air books; the walls are covered in coloured Post-it Notes; “fail fast” reads one of the “motivational” signs on the wall. 
Welcome to M&S’s digital hub. Two-and-a-half years ago it consisted of half a dozen people. Today there are more than 200 developers and product managers. 
“Four years ago we had no platform. We were effectively Subscribe now
